properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:21AM CST until January 12 at 4:21PM CST by NWS Fort Worth TX
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a Flood
Warning for the following areas in Texas...

Cowleech Fork Sabine River At Greenville Affecting Hunt County
South Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan Affecting Hunt and Rockwall
Counties

The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Cowleech Fork Sabine River At Greenville.
* from late tonight to Sunday afternoon...Or until the warning is
cancelled.
* At 0945 AM Friday the stage was 4.69 feet.
* Flood stage is 14.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river should rise above flood stage after midnight
Saturday and continue to rise to a crest near 15 feet by
Saturday afternoon. The river should fall below flood stage
after midnight Sunday.
* At 15 feet, Caution should be exercised near the river because of
minor out of bank flow.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Stay tuned to NOAA All Hazards Radio for the latest river forecasts.
